title: Bug 47910 - ajc outjar jarfile does not contain MANIFEST.MF
description: When using ajc to compile source files with the outjar option, the resulting JAR file is missing the MANIFEST.MF file.
OB: When I execute the command 'ajc sourceroots <mydir> outjar <my.jar,' an output file is created with a .jar extension. However, upon inspection, it is not a valid JAR file because it lacks the required MANIFEST.MF file. The documentation for ajc mentions the usage of 'outjar <file>' to put output classes in a zip file, but it appears contradictory as creating a zip file does not align with the expectation of generating a JAR file.
EB: If the 'outjar' option is used, the resulting file should be a valid JAR file, complete with the necessary MANIFEST.MF file. The behavior should align with typical JAR file structure and specifications.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Execute the command 'ajc sourceroots <mydir> outjar <my.jar>' in the specified directory.
2. Check the contents of the generated JAR file to verify the absence of the MANIFEST.MF file.
